trans-unit.source: Provides an abstract container class for project elements.
Gets a recursive depth-first enumerator over all child elements.
Recursion is possible because project element containers may contain children that are themselves project element containers.
Returns a recursive depth-first enumerator over all child elements.
Appends the child element as the last child of this project container.

Throws an exception if this project container is not parented, or if the `child` element is already parented, or if the `child` element was created by a different <xref:Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectRootElement>.
The project element to be appended.
Gets all child elements.
Returns all child elements.
Gets all child elements, starting from the last child.
Returns all child elements, starting from the last child.
Gets the number of child elements.
Returns the number of child elements.
Gets the first child element.
Use <xref:Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectElementContainer.PrependChild%2A> to initialize this property.
Returns the first child element.
Returns null if no child element exists.
Inserts the child element after the reference element.
If the `reference` element is null, this method is equivalent to <xref:Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectElementContainer.PrependChild%2A>.

Throws an exception if this project container is not parented, or if the `child` element is already parented, or if the `child` element was created by a different <xref:Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectRootElement>, or if the `reference` element is not a child of this project container.
The project element to be inserted.
The project element to be inserted after.
Inserts the child element before the reference element.
If the `reference` element is null, this method is equivalent to <xref:Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectElementContainer.AppendChild%2A>.

Throws an exception if this project container is not parented, or if the `child` element is already parented, or if the `child` element was created by a different <xref:Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectRootElement>, or if the `reference` element is not a child of this project container.
The project element to be inserted.
The project element to be inserted before.
Gets the last child element.
Use <xref:Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectElementContainer.AppendChild%2A> to initialize this property.
Returns the last child element.
Returns null if no child element exists.
Prepends the child element as the first child of this project container.

Throws an exception if this project container is not parented, or if the `child` element is already parented, or if the `child` element was created by a different <xref:Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectRootElement>.
The project element to be prepended.
Removes all the children, if any, from this project container.
It is safe to modify the children in this way during enumeration.
Removes a child element from this project container.
Throws an exception if the child element is not currently parented by this project container.
It is safe to remove a child this way during enumeration.
The project element to be removed.
